t: Matthew 10
And*p when he had called unto him his twelve disciples, he gave them power against unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease.
Now*p the names of the twelve apostles are these; The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;
Philip,*p and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;
Simon*p the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
These*p twelve Jesus sent forth, and commanded them, saying, Go*r not*r into*r the*r way*r of*r the*r Gentiles,*r and*r into*r any*r city*r of*r the*r Samaritans*r enter*r ye*r not:*r
But*rp go*r rather*r to*r the*r lost*r sheep*r of*r the*r house*r of*r Israel.*r
And*rp as*r ye*r go,*r preach,*r saying,*r The*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r at*r hand.*r
Heal*rp the*r sick,*r cleanse*r the*r lepers,*r raise*r the*r dead,*r cast*r out*r devils:*r freely*r ye*r have*r received,*r freely*r give.*r
Provide*rp neither*r gold,*r nor*r silver,*r nor*r brass*r in*r your*r purses,*r
Nor*rp scrip*r for*r your*r journey,*r neither*r two*r coats,*r neither*r shoes,*r nor*r yet*r staves:*r for*r the*r workman*r is*r worthy*r of*r his*r meat.*r
And*rp into*r whatsoever*r city*r or*r town*r ye*r shall*r enter,*r enquire*r who*r in*r it*r is*r worthy;*r and*r there*r abide*r till*r ye*r go*r thence.*r
And*rp when*r ye*r come*r into*r an*r house,*r salute*r it.*r
And*rp if*r the*r house*r be*r worthy,*r let*r your*r peace*r come*r upon*r it:*r but*r if*r it*r be*r not*r worthy,*r let*r your*r peace*r return*r to*r you.*r
And*rp whosoever*r shall*r not*r receive*r you,*r nor*r hear*r your*r words,*r when*r ye*r depart*r out*r of*r that*r house*r or*r city,*r shake*r off*r the*r dust*r of*r your*r feet.*r
Verily*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r It*r shall*r be*r more*r tolerable*r for*r the*r land*r of*r Sodom*r and*r Gomorrha*r in*r the*r day*r of*r judgment,*r than*r for*r that*r city.*r
Behold,*rp I*r send*r you*r forth*r as*r sheep*r in*r the*r midst*r of*r wolves:*r be*r ye*r therefore*r wise*r as*r serpents,*r and*r harmless*r as*r doves.*r
But*rp beware*r of*r men:*r for*r they*r will*r deliver*r you*r up*r to*r the*r councils,*r and*r they*r will*r scourge*r you*r in*r their*r synagogues;*r
And*rp ye*r shall*r be*r brought*r before*r governors*r and*r kings*r for*r my*r sake,*r for*r a*r testimony*r against*r them*r and*r the*r Gentiles.*r
But*rp when*r they*r deliver*r you*r up,*r take*r no*r thought*r how*r or*r what*r ye*r shall*r speak:*r for*r it*r shall*r be*r given*r you*r in*r that*r same*r hour*r what*r ye*r shall*r speak.*r
For*rp it*r is*r not*r ye*r that*r speak,*r but*r the*r Spirit*r of*r your*r Father*r which*r speaketh*r in*r you.*r

And*rp the*r brother*r shall*r deliver*r up*r the*r brother*r to*r death,*r and*r the*r father*r the*r child:*r and*r the*r children*r shall*r rise*r up*r against*r their*r parents,*r and*r cause*r them*r to*r be*r put*r to*r death.*r
And*rp ye*r shall*r be*r hated*r of*r all*r men*r for*r my*r name's*r sake:*r but*r he*r that*r endureth*r to*r the*r end*r shall*r be*r saved.*r

But*rp when*r they*r persecute*r you*r in*r this*r city,*r flee*r ye*r into*r another:*r for*r verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Ye*r shall*r not*r have*r gone*r over*r the*r cities*r of*r Israel,*r till*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r be*r come.*r
The*rp disciple*r is*r not*r above*r his*r master,*r nor*r the*r servant*r above*r his*r lord.*r

It*rp is*r enough*r for*r the*r disciple*r that*r he*r be*r as*r his*r master,*r and*r the*r servant*r as*r his*r lord.*r If*r they*r have*r called*r the*r master*r of*r the*r house*r Beelzebub,*r how*r much*r more*r shall*r they*r call*r them*r of*r his*r household?*r
Fear*rp them*r not*r therefore:*r for*r there*r is*r nothing*r covered,*r that*r shall*r not*r be*r revealed;*r and*r hid,*r that*r shall*r not*r be*r known.*r
What*rp I*r tell*r you*r in*r darkness,*r that*r speak*r ye*r in*r light:*r and*r what*r ye*r hear*r in*r the*r ear,*r that*r preach*r ye*r upon*r the*r housetops.*r

And*rp fear*r not*r them*r which*r kill*r the*r body,*r but*r are*r not*r able*r to*r kill*r the*r soul:*r but*r rather*r fear*r him*r which*r is*r able*r to*r destroy*r both*r soul*r and*r body*r in*r hell.*r
Are*rp not*r two*r sparrows*r sold*r for*r a*r farthing?*r and*r one*r of*r them*r shall*r not*r fall*r on*r the*r ground*r without*r your*r Father.*r
But*rp the*r very*r hairs*r of*r your*r head*r are*r all*r numbered.*r
Fear*rp ye*r not*r therefore,*r ye*r are*r of*r more*r value*r than*r many*r sparrows.*r
Whosoever*rp therefore*r shall*r confess*r me*r before*r men,*r him*r will*r I*r confess*r also*r before*r my*r Father*r which*r is*r in*r heaven.*r
But*rp whosoever*r shall*r deny*r me*r before*r men,*r him*r will*r I*r also*r deny*r before*r my*r Father*r which*r is*r in*r heaven.*r
Think*rp not*r that*r I*r am*r come*r to*r send*r peace*r on*r earth:*r I*r came*r not*r to*r send*r peace,*r but*r a*r sword.*r

For*rp I*r am*r come*r to*r set*r a*r man*r at*r variance*r against*r his*r father,*r and*r the*r daughter*r against*r her*r mother,*r and*r the*r daughter*r in*r law*r against*r her*r mother*r in*r law.*r
And*rp a*r man's*r foes*r shall*r be*r they*r of*r his*r own*r household.*r
He*rp that*r loveth*r father*r or*r mother*r more*r than*r me*r is*r not*r worthy*r of*r me:*r and*r he*r that*r loveth*r son*r or*r daughter*r more*r than*r me*r is*r not*r worthy*r of*r me.*r
And*rp he*r that*r taketh*r not*r his*r cross,*r and*r followeth*r after*r me,*r is*r not*r worthy*r of*r me.*r
He*rp that*r findeth*r his*r life*r shall*r lose*r it:*r and*r he*r that*r loseth*r his*r life*r for*r my*r sake*r shall*r find*r it.*r
He*rp that*r receiveth*r you*r receiveth*r me,*r and*r he*r that*r receiveth*r me*r receiveth*r him*r that*r sent*r me.*r

He*rp that*r receiveth*r a*r prophet*r in*r the*r name*r of*r a*r prophet*r shall*r receive*r a*r prophet's*r reward;*r and*r he*r that*r receiveth*r a*r righteous*r man*r in*r the*r name*r of*r a*r righteous*r man*r shall*r receive*r a*r righteous*r man's*r reward.*r

And*rp whosoever*r shall*r give*r to*r drink*r unto*r one*r of*r these*r little*r ones*r a*r cup*r of*r cold*r water*r only*r in*r the*r name*r of*r a*r disciple,*r verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r he*r shall*r in*r no*r wise*r lose*r his*r reward.*r
